articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces are just 1.5 km (1 mile) outside the Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk after Russian units pushed up from the south towards the road and rail hub which had a pre-war population of 60,000 people, a prominent pro-Russian blogger said on Friday.
articles.title: Russian forces advance towards strategic city in Ukraine's east, war blogger says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean opposition leader Lee Jae-myung said on Friday the best way to restore order in the country is to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol, a day ahead of a planned parliamentary vote over Yoon's short-lived imposition of martial law.
articles.title: South Korea opposition leader Lee says impeaching Yoon best way to restore order

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: At least 35 Palestinians were killed early on Thursday in Israeli bombings of various areas in the Gaza Strip, the Palestinian news agency WAFA reported.
articles.title: Israeli strikes on Gaza kill 35 Palestinians on Thursday, Palestinian news agency reports

articles.author: Ben Blanchard, Yimou Lee, Angie Teo
articles.description: Beijing has unveiled a new tactic on Taiwan, the democratic island it claims as its own, officials and experts say: large-scale drills with no fanfare to normalise a heightened military presence and let the U.S. know that China can act whenever it wants.
articles.title: China's new tactic against Taiwan: drills 'that dare not speak their name'

articles.author: Mahmoud Hasano
articles.description: Basim Faiz Mawat stood in the Damascus cell that his fellow prisoners used to call the "death dormitory", struggling to believe that the system that abused him for so long had been overthrown and his suffering had ended.
articles.title: Freed Syrian prisoners return to their 'death dormitory'

articles.author: Joe Cash
articles.description: As Donald Trump steps up his tariff threats against China, Beijing is moving to beat the next U.S. president to the punch with its own restrictions and get Washington to the negotiating table ahead of a full-blown trade war, analysts say.
articles.title: China eyes negotiations as Trump threatens new tariffs

articles.author: Emma Farge, Cecile Mantovani
articles.description: Switzerland wants to update its network of ageing nuclear shelters, which are increasingly seen as an asset at a time of greater global uncertainty, notably since Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
articles.title: Switzerland plans revamp of Cold War-era nuclear bunker network

articles.author: Tala Ramadan
articles.description: A fire broke out early on Friday at a private elderly care centre in Jordan, leaving six residents dead and five critically injured, according to Jordanian Social Development Minister Wafa Bani Mustafa, Jordan's state news agency Petra reported.
articles.title: Six dead, five critically injured in fire at Jordanian elderly care centre

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko, Pavel Polityuk
articles.description: Russia launched a large-scale missile attack on Ukrainian energy facilities during the morning rush hour on Friday, Kyiv said, while explosions were heard in the Black Sea port of Odesa and other cities in western Ukraine.
articles.title: Russia launches major missile attack on Ukrainian power facilities, Kyiv says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin on Friday praised U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's criticism of Ukrainian strikes with U.S. missiles deep into Russian territory and said the position was fully in line with Moscow's own position.
articles.title: Kremlin praises Trump's criticism of Ukrainian strikes deep into Russia
